channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Madrid gets a fraction of the American visitors that pour into other European capitals, but that may be changing now that more sophisticated travelers are discovering the city’s inexhaustible attractions and surprising affordability. https://t.co/VKrvW7xeJ0
Vladimir Putin believes that Ukraine has no historical identity independent of Russia. Many Russian liberals and dissidents have traditionally agreed, writes @yarotrof. https://t.co/CHcPkhIQHx

The first cargo of Ukrainian corn to be exported via the Black Sea since Russia’s invasion set sail from a Romanian port Friday, dodging a Russian naval blockade that has all but halted Ukraine’s grain exports. https://t.co/1lA5ujfMEZ

As Elon Musk’s crusade against Twitter escalated from a war of words to a full-on takeover, he was egged on behind the scenes by a mix of voices—from fellow billionaires to internet trolls—with their own beefs with the social-media platform https://t.co/7pFiHOWyj6
TikTok brain is real, researchers say, and it’s affecting kids’ brain development. "We’ve made kids live in a candy store." https://t.co/gcXaQ16pgv

From @WSJopinion: Many people seem offended by the kind of wealth that Elon Musk can use as disposable income. Are they right to be? Is the existence of a huge disparity in wealth a problem for American culture? https://t.co/KUeFdRTojr
Warren Buffett blamed the financial industry for motivating risky behavior among investors https://t.co/aQjth8mwkB
Record-high fertilizer prices have investors and farmers taking a closer look at alternatives, including products that harness microbes https://t.co/mMZJwXErAR
Palm oil is one of the world’s most ubiquitous food commodities, found in candy bars, ice cream, pizza dough and cooking oil. It is about to get harder to source. https://t.co/dO9IH4yk1S

If it is finalized, Todd Boehly’s deal for Chelsea would mean that American investors will hold majority stakes in more English Premier League clubs (seven) than investors from the U.K. (six). https://t.co/NQX5XnVsUT

Alarmed by growing numbers of carjackings and other street crimes, several affluent Chicago neighborhoods have signed up for patrols by armed off-duty police officers to create what some security companies are calling virtual gated communities https://t.co/TBPpfjLEDJ
Elon Musk broke nearly every rule in the deal-making playbook. How he landed Twitter anyway. https://t.co/4SrVIti1tV
Kaitlyn Younger applied to five Ivy League schools, plus Stanford and Berkeley, with a 1550 on her SAT. None accepted her. https://t.co/gnfT2OjYG3
Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos are two of the richest men on earth. Now the billionaires are taking their dueling business ventures to space. https://t.co/nNnfJJPpGQ
Venus and Jupiter will appear to collide this week in a planetary conjunction, with best viewing just before sunrise on April 30 and May 1 https://t.co/rg7Thu5k6O
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/fwXRnpQtTi https://t.co/mAMs9nyELu
In an excerpt from his new memoir “Tough,” NFL player turned actor Terry Crews recalls how sweeping floors for a living taught him the value of work. https://t.co/RlLOhc4Qgs
Poland has donated at least 240 Soviet-style tanks to Ukraine as allies race to help Ukraine rebuff Russia’s advance in the east of the country https://t.co/7XCAKo94YF
The West now sees a realistic prospect of Ukrainian success that pushes Russia farther out and deters Moscow from future land grabs https://t.co/uXVNOq5hiL
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/YoLpfh0AwA

An analysis of more than 15,000 of Elon Musk’s tweets, classified by topic, time of day and other factors, provides insight into what excites and enrages one of the world’s most unorthodox CEOs https://t.co/Rkgn3OGIVf
The Ukraine war started with Western efforts at damage control. It’s now one that offers the West a chance to limit Russia’s expansionist ambitions https://t.co/xBwfJXXVhx
Weapons supplied by the U.S. and other Western allies are playing a critical role in enabling Ukrainian forces to repel the massive onslaught of Russian armor https://t.co/GE9v3wfuNt
The Federal Reserve waited too long to take on inflation and its response to it will almost certainly trigger a recession, according to three former central bank officials https://t.co/5gNRF6fWBN

As Elon Musk’s crusade against Twitter escalated from a war of words to a full-on takeover, he was egged on behind the scenes by a mix of voices—from fellow billionaires to internet trolls—with their own beefs with the social-media platform https://t.co/2dITfrE1mQ
The FBI conducted potentially millions of searches of Americans’ electronic data last year without a warrant, a U.S. intelligence report said https://t.co/A66wtJeTRK

Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer was suspended without pay for 324 games under Major League Baseball’s domestic-violence policy, an unprecedented punishment representing two full seasons for one of the highest-paid players in the sport’s history https://t.co/nxszc8zO9P
A New York judge on Friday denied Donald Trump’s request to end contempt-of-court fines for not complying with a civil subpoena from the state attorney general https://t.co/a2eAs2ssdQ
Friends of Elon Musk who disliked Twitter’s direction—including “PayPal mafia”—secretly pushed him to launch a bid for the platform https://t.co/g7FWc9hhe9

From @WSJopinion: Putin really may break the nuclear taboo. It seems unthinkable, but American leaders’ failure to think about it heightens the risk it will happen, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/47xJJThKVz

Javelin missiles and other weapons supplied by the U.S. and Western allies play a critical role in enabling Ukraine to repel Russia’s onslaught. The bottleneck for this influx of aid is training. “You need to behave like snipers. Play spy games.” https://t.co/ahOo6nnnfH

Airbnb is telling employees they can now work from almost anywhere in the world without a pay cut in a move that could entice other companies to follow suit and bolster the company’s business https://t.co/sToJXOzfUB
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/9vBe3tO0wN
The FBI conducted potentially millions of searches of Americans’ electronic data last year without a warrant, a U.S. intelligence report said https://t.co/cNmrSoHJkM
Poland has donated at least 240 Soviet-style tanks to Ukraine as allies race to help Ukraine rebuff Russia’s advance in the east of the country https://t.co/F2xvwlSiil
Elon Musk has sold roughly $8.5 billion worth of Tesla stock in the three days after agreeing to buy Twitter for $44 billion, according to regulatory filings https://t.co/phzBbs5R2S

After a record number of people bought guns during the pandemic, some cities are reporting more firearms are being stolen and used in murders, including the recent mass shooting in Sacramento https://t.co/8qlEg8OFyG

Breaking: Los Angeles Dodgers part-owner Todd Boehly is set to enter exclusive talks in the bidding war to acquire Chelsea FC from Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich, people familiar with the matter say https://t.co/7Do1pdO4uq

Airbnb is telling employees they can now work from almost anywhere in the world without a pay cut in a move that could entice other companies to follow suit and bolster the company’s business https://t.co/PvZLdOWWWx
Without foreign middlemen, Russia will struggle to find buyers for its oil, the foundation of the country’s economic wealth https://t.co/PQ9MBziF2o

Elon Musk sold roughly $4 billion worth of Tesla stock after agreeing to buy Twitter, as he looks for cash to finance his takeover of the social-media company #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/3HC40QOOdw https://t.co/KJY6mUSek3

Javelin missiles and other weapons supplied by the U.S. and Western allies play a critical role in enabling Ukrainian forces to repel Russia’s massive onslaught; a bottleneck is training https://t.co/UfYVsqf2mu

Russian forces have riddled Ukrainian fields with mines and destroyed equipment, in what farmers and Kyiv say is a deliberate effort to hurt Ukraine’s globally important agricultural industry https://t.co/gvjE0Y6Sqv

Elon Musk has sold roughly $4 billion worth of Tesla stock in the two days after agreeing to buy Twitter for $44 billion, according to regulatory filings made public late Thursday https://t.co/yfQne2ajOW
Amazon posted its first quarterly loss since 2015, hurt by slower sales growth and its stake in electric-vehicle maker Rivian https://t.co/548FYyuM0V
Apple posted one of its best quarters in its 46-year history as iPhone sales exceeded expectations https://t.co/u9vZmsGvUM
Corn and soybeans prices have risen nearly to records, signaling higher food inflation to come https://t.co/QLHy1ttV4g

Elon Musk reported selling a total of more than 4.4 million Tesla shares on Tuesday and Wednesday at prices between about $870 and $1,000 a share, filings show. “No further TSLA sales planned after today," Musk tweeted Thursday. https://t.co/iDZbAuoidR
With foreign exporters pulling out, Russia will struggle to find buyers for its oil, the foundation of the country's economic wealth https://t.co/cO7Ago4yef
A person in Colorado has tested positive for a version of avian influenza, the first known human case in the U.S. of a bird flu that has ravaged poultry flocks https://t.co/z2VDcENqdT
